title: Students, faculty and Maryland officials celebrate groundbreaking of public policy school
author: Eric Neugeboren

image.alt: University of Maryland officials and state and local leaders at the groundbreaking ceremony for the new School of Public Policy building on October 29, 2019. (Eric Neugeboren/For The Diamondback)

blurb:
University of Maryland officials, flanked by state and local leaders, celebrated the groundbreaking of a new public policy school building Tuesday.

The 70,000 square foot building will be located between the Lee Building and Rossborough Inn, said Bill Olen, the planning and construction director for this universityâ€™s Facilities Management. It will be the first time that public policy classes will all be in one building, Maryland Senate President Mike Miller said. Various buildings on the campus have previously housed the classes.
